cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 25 miles E of Wilmington, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: The hurricane is drifting west-northwest, forecast to move slowly inland across southeastern North Carolina and extreme eastern South Carolina, then curve northward across the western Carolinas and central Appalachians through early next week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Wilmington, North Carolina (Cape Fear area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch and Storm Surge Watch from Edisto Beach SC to South Santee River SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane & Storm Surge Warnings from South Santee River SC northward to Duck NC; Tropical Storm Warning from Edisto Beach SC to South Santee River SC and portions of NC/VA coast
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire North Carolina coast, most of South Carolina coast, with tropical-storm impacts extending southward to the Georgia coast including the Port of Savannah
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph with higher gusts) possible late Friday night through Saturday near Savannah.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–3 ft possible along the Georgia coast, especially at times of high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain totaling 2–6 inches could cause localized flooding in the Savannah area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along Georgia beaches; brief tornado threat inland if outer rain bands reach the area.
